result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary W. Craven was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: and DOC supervision fees to be paid during supervision, work out payment plan with agent.
To be paid during supervision, work out payment plan with agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
DNA sample previously provided.
Pay DNA surcharge.

Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to possess or consume any prescription medications without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
No contact with G.C., A.H. or their immediate families.  Contact with K.S. with agent's prior knowledge and approval.
Follow through with any counseling, assessments and treatment as recommended by agent.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

Court imposes:  Count 1 - Imposed & Stayed 3 years 6 months; 1 year 6 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision.  Def is eligible for CIP & SAP.  3 years probation.
Conditions:
8 months jail, credit for 230 days.
Costs, service fees of $35, $100 buy money, DNA surcharge (sample previously provided) and DOC supervision fees to be paid during supervision, work out payment plan with agent.
No contact with G.C., A.H. or their immediate families.  Contact with K.S. with agent's prior knowledge and approval.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is not to possess or consume of any prescription medications without a valid prescription.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.
Follow through with any counseling, assessments and treatment as recommended by agent.
Count 3 - Imposed & Stayed 3 years 6 months; 1 year 6 months initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to count 1.  3 years probation, consecutive to count 1.
